Sentencas: An increasing demand in the marine industry to reduce emissions led to investigations into more efficient power conversion using fuels with sustainable production pathways.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFCs) are under consideration for long-range shipping, because of its high efficiency, low pollutant emissions, and fuel flexibility.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: SOFC systems also have great potential to cater for the heat demand in ships, but the heat integration is not often considered when assessing its feasibility.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: This study evaluates the electrical and heat efficiency of a 100 kW SOFC system for marine applications fuelled with methane, methanol, diesel, ammonia, or hydrogen.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: In addition, cathode off-gas recirculation (COGR) is investigated to tackle low oxygen utilisation and thus improve heat regeneration.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: The software Cycle Tempo is used to simulate the power plant, which uses a 1D model for the SOFCs.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: At nominal conditions , the highest net electrical efficiency (LHV) was found for methane (58.1%), followed by diesel (57.6%), and ammonia (55.1%).
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: The highest heat efficiency was found for ammonia (27.4%), followed by hydrogen (25.6%).
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: COGR resulted in similar electrical efficiencies, but increased the heat efficiency by 11.9% to 105.0% for the different fuels.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: The model was verified with a sensitivity analysis and validated by comparison with similar studies.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems

Sentencas: It is concluded that COGR is a promising method to increase the heat efficiency of marine SOFC systems.
Titulo: The effects of fuel type and cathode off-gas recirculation on combined heat and power generation of marine SOFC systems
